intro: Fibigia kermanshahensis, commonly known as the Kermanshah hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to Iran. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, hibiscus-like flowers. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. Its leaves are usually broad and slightly hairy, while its flowers are typically pink or red in color. Fibigia kermanshahensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited geographic distribution.
